comment.body:
This is because of
`appleinsider.com,dappradar.com,euroweeklynews.com,thefinancialbrand.com##[rel*="sponsored"]`
in EasyList.
Maybe it has to be reported to EasyList maintainers.

comment.body:
Screenshot 1 (annoyances - cookies):
`justnerd.it###cookiescript_injected`

Screenshot 2 (ads):
`justnerd.it##div[data-selector^=".ai-insert-"]`

Screenshot 3 (social):
`justnerd.it##.share-it`
or
`justnerd.it##article .share-it`

Screenshot 4 (social) (only mobile):
`justnerd.it###mob-bot-share`

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

issue.title: tandem.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://tandem.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Ftandem.com) ### Comment > Dear Ad block, unfortunately your app doesn't automatically start after the phone is on stand by. The ad bock seems to deactivate itself. I put on the automatic start when restart of the phone already. It did not help. I would even pay the premium version, but the protection is not allowed to ever stop. Only I put it manually of course. > I mean the switch at the beginning of your app, is sometimes deactivated, without me deactivating it. This must change. Someone must bear me a sure liability for that. Than I would even buy the premium subscription. > > Best regards > > Martin Kleinert ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/jblqbezspnkksc04c4kkc8cg0ok8ks4ru2wc3emaeo.jpg?nc=1)

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.title: www.youtube.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Social Widget) [https://www.youtube.com/@tunetankmusic/about](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2F%40tunetankmusic%2Fabout) ### Comment > I used AdGuard on Chromium, Brave, and Firefox. While AdGuard is active I can not unsubscribe from any video on YouTube on any browser. Disabling and trying the page again fails. If I disable AdGuard, close the browsers, then restart, the unsubscribe button is visible again. I did update filters. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/cq7zhgkoi08o4skkkgwcg8ggock0socbliaty4vxnk.jpg?nc=1)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production

issue.title: Twitch.tv Shows Ads on Channel Join

labels.name: Stale
labels.description: The issue is considered as obsolete

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

4.2

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Chrome

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

Www.twitch.tv

### Ad Blocking

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter, EasyList

### Privacy

AdGuard URL Tracking filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyPrivacy

### Social Widgets

_No response_

### Annoyances

_No response_

### Security

_No response_

### Other

_No response_

### DNS filters

AdGuard DNS filter

### Language-specific

_No response_

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. Twitch App and Twitch.tv show ads whenever you join a channel.  I've also tested this in Chrome, Samsung, and Firefox with the same results

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

![Screenshot_20231116_083620_Firefox](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/151312462/538a837d-6258-4138-b3ac-e8cd8b98cc6f)
![Screenshot_20231112_143858_Chrome](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/151312462/be443117-a316-43f4-9fe6-23b923a46fb9)


</details>

<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition
